I downloaded the binary version of Ant v1.3 and used it perfectly with JDK1.3.
I have a RedHat 7.1 desktop (x86).

Here is my java -version:
java version "1.4.0-beta"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.0-beta-b65)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.4.0-beta-b65, mixed mode)

Here is my ant -version:
Ant version 1.3 compiled on March 26 2001

Here is what happens when I try to run ant:
Buildfile: build.xml
/home/chris/echo/java/ant/bin/ant: line 107:  6029 Segmentation fault     
$JAVACMD -classpath "$LOCALCLASSPATH" -debug -Dant.home="${ANT_HOME}" $ANT_OPTS
org.apache.tools.ant.Main "$@"

I regularly use jikes for compilation.  The above problem is witnessed when I'm
using Jikes && when I do not use Jikes (just javac).

Unfortunately, Java creates no core file.  I've submitted an official bug to the
JDK1.4 folks and the response they had was "huh?".

Any clues?  Seen this before?


-Chris
